intro: Guthriea capensis, commonly known as the Cape Guthriea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the region. It produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Guthriea capensis is often found in coastal and mountainous areas, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
